title: WCAS GERMAN 245-0-20 Special Topics in German Literature and Culture
class_attributes:
Literature & Fine Arts Distro Area

Reading, writing, speaking proficiency

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This cultural studies course explores stories through music and the stories behind the music. We will study intersections between narratives and musical expression while exploring the mysterious language of music in the context of German culture. Spanning the works of composers from Beethoven, Mozart, Schubert, and Johann Strauss to political chansons and current popular music, an emphasis will be placed on the historical and literary backdrop that inspired the musical works as well as musical characteristics, linguistic elements, and interpretive aspects. Highlights will be a discussion of Beethoven`s Ninth Symphony and Schiller`s poetry, selected renditions of Goethe`s poetry by Schubert and other composers, and we will attend a live performance of Richard Strauss` Der Rosenkavalier at the Lyric Opera on Monday evening, February 8, 2016. We will also look at musical culture in the 20th Century and venture into the world of Liedermacher as well as other popular and experimental music.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
German 102-3 or permission of instructor
Reading, writing, speaking proficiency in German

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? Students will expand their vocabulary in the context of music and the works
? Students will be able to recognize the genres such as musical critiques and they will be able to produce texts in these genres in German
? We will work with specific topics in grammar in order to review challenging concepts and introduce more advanced concepts relevant to the musical works studied
? Students will engage in presentations, possibly involving performances and improve their oral skills
? Students will develop an understanding of the history of German music

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, discussion, films/videos, field trips, lecture, presentations, simulations/role-play, writing assignments

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, Class Participation, Exams, Group Projects, Homework, Online Work, Presentations, Quizzes, Simulation/Role-Play, Writing Assignments
